+NatakuGundam15 As for the wiki website, do NOT believe everything they say 
on it, cause for a matter of fact, I can go into the site and reedit it as 
your Wings of Light is absolutely useless as Wacky said. As for when the 
Wings of Light first activate, do you notice that Shin do it in Seed mode? 
Turn back time when Kira first activate his Seed mode, did you ever notice 
that the Strike gain the SPEED just like the Destiny? Does the Strike have 
the Wings of Light? No. So how can it Speed up? The answer lies in the 
pilot himself. In Seed mode, they push the accelerator pedal stronger, so 
the thrusters work stronger, therefore the MS move faster, even sometime 
stronger, like a warrior in berserker mode. It doesn't have anything to do 
with the Wings of Light. So as Wacky said, the Wings of Light can only be 
used to confuse other MS so it can't be locked on.

Another note, would you please use comma, stop dot or something like that, 
it's really hard to follow your comments. Beside, Wacky uses English as his 
first language, as his mother language, why do you ask him if he understand 
English? It's thanks to him that I know my English hearing is still good. 
I'm Vietnamese actually.

On final note, the GAME broke a lot of things when use MS. As for the 
Strike Freedom in Dynasty Warrior 2, how can it use it's Dragoon on Earth? 
The Dragoon system can ONLY use in SPACE for the Gravity force is too great 
and it will pull the Dragoons down. That's why you never see Kira uses the 
Dragoon for fighting on Earth. So please do not use GAME as references for

A rather late, non-constructive comment on this fans' designed MS:
1. The Numbering seems off; I don't think ZGMF-X7x means what he think it 
means. I don't think the people who made the reference number had a model 
they could point to that started with a 7; to this point I think the only 
ZAFT suit to include the 7 anywhere in the model number would be the GINN 
and it's magical variants. Using that magical logic it'd end up using the 4 
instead of the 7. Making the model number closer to ZGMF-X41T rather than 
ZGMF-X71T
2. Paint scheme while nice might not come off as "Shinn's Color" as a black 
as a focus has been done on The Blitz (SEED), The Gaia (SEED Destiny, 
Stella Loussier Use), the Destroy (SEED Destiny), Crossbone Gundam X-1, 
Master Gundam (G Gundam) and Gundam Spiegel (G Gundam). As for representing 
"Shinn" if the sword defines whom Shinn is supposed to be emulating (while 
in the Impulse there was the Excalibur anti-ship swords thus King Arthur, 
while in the Destiny it's the Arondight so he's suddenly Lancelot.) It's 
not a bad paint scheme by any stretch but I wouldn't call it original and 
it wouldn't likely strike me as being "Shinn's Color" and anger is usually 
denoted by the color Red (so I would have assume the Arch Destiny's VPS 
would be switching with a red focus for melee/speed and black if desired 
for ranged combat.) Anyhow Shinn prefers to fight in close range (mainly 
with melee weapons) this might be because his family died due to two beams 
hitting each other and killing off his family while he does engage in 
ranged combat, he seems to prefer melee combat.
3. Pierrot tear may reference Master Gundam (making Shinn Finger a 
reference to Darkness Finger which seems to be a variant of Shinning 
finger.) This may also play into that Shinn might be a strong fighter and 
"good" intentions but fighting for the wrong reasons.
4. The Suit had various thrusters all over the body like most other gundams 
to handle simple maneuvers, having the wings articulated can change the 
silhouette of the gundam as well. He does state the removal of the Voiture 
Lumiere propulsion system but what about the Mirage Colloid Holographic 
Projection System (since the Destiny has 3 high-cost systems running, it's 
not that much of a guess why the nuclear power isn't enough.) Replacing 
Voiture Lumiere system with high-output thrusters in the wings is fine but 
for accelerating towards or away from the enemy but the Mirage Colloid 
would help with not being targeted by people who are familiar with the 
system.
5. Palma Fiocina seems to be designed as a built-in weapon as a means to 
counter armored units and units with Variable Phase Shift (note: The 
Destroy's head being destroyed by it.) By changing it to a ranged weapon 
that is larger with semi-automatic function to it as well changes the 
overall battle style as it shifts the focus to more of mid-range unit. Also 
how does the semi-automatic functionality adjust to the situation, does the 
pilot have to calibrate every shot or does it repeat every shot. Also will 
there be a system to regulate heat as I would assume a lot of shots would 
build up heat up rather quickly especially if the pilot was emotional 
unstable or having a mental breakdown.
5.2 By having the weapons charged and used by the new Palma Fiocina, will 
it have a legacy hand-plug (note: the scene in Seed Destiny when the Gaia 
uses the Strike Rouge's beam rifle) or will it all be based on these arch 
destiny's new system?
6. Having pile bunkers, while cool doesn't exactly have the same feeling as 
a Shinning Finger, Burning Finger, Darkness Finger or Shinn Finger. For 
some reason I'd also for it to take a number from The Big-O, namely the 
Sudden Impact attack but that's just me.
7. The Beam rifle looks nice, but it goes back to 5.2 along with if they 
were going to have it have an overclock feature that'd mean a level of 
production because of the chances of someone not paying attention. Why not 
also include a "Deuterion Beam Energy Transfer System"-esque function to it 
so a discarded rifle can act as a impromptu turret?
It's certainly impressive that fans could come up with a MS like this and 
it's got it's own merits. A cheers to them and their hard work.﻿

The only critical thing I can make about this Gundam is that it should be 
suffering from major heat issues and energy problems.

Beam rifles all have a delay between shots because it uses a capacitor-like 
mechanism where after each shot it takes a few seconds for the chamber to 
be refilled with particles (mirage colloid?). That's why high energy 
weapons take a long time to charge up, because you need to fill that 
capacitor before you empty it at once. So how would the induction system 
work? Not to mention that energy just doesn't 100% transfer, its usually 
converted into kinetic energy aka heat. With that much energy being 
transferred melting or overheating at those points.

Ascalon is also a problem. The larger the beam the slower it moves. So it's 
going to be bending all over the place (then again one can say that this is 
a high skill weapon. High skill high reward).

Wacky, recoil is space works differently. With no gravity or friction 
keeping your feet in place, instead you move backwards. Thus the laws of 
physics at work, for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. 
So when the Ragnarok fires at that rate with that much force coming out in 
one place then that much force is pushing the Arch Destiny back. Doesn't 
matter if you're holding it two hands or not, that's just for accuracy.

1.) Don't look at me, dude. That's just ZAFT's numbering system. Idk? XD

2.) Is anyone FORCING YOU to go that stupidly fast that it might put strain

Destiny is capable of going when pushed to it's maximum thrust. But just 
because it CAN go that fast, doesn't mean you are FORCED to go that fast. 
Keep that in mind.

3.) Because the Tombstones combine both Physical AND Energy Elements with 
HIGHLY CONCENTRATED Beam Energy focused at one point. If it was a Pure 
Energy Spike, most shields can easily block that. But what's different 
about the Tombstone is that it's Both Physical AND Energy in one weapon. 
It's a Physical Spike that's Enveloped in Beam Energy and that it focuses 
and concentrates all the Beam Energy emitting from the spike all to the TIP 
of the spike. The energy is so highly concentrated and the blow is so quick 
that Shields; but Energy AND Physical, don't have enough time to disperse 
the impact and absorb the blow.
THAT is why the Tombstones are an Unblockable Weapon. Does that make them 
OP? HELL NO! Because you still have to get RIGHT IN YOUR OPPONENT'S FACE to 
use them. That alone is MORE THAN ENOUGH of a trade-off if you ask me.

was an EARTH ALLIANCE TECH at first.

Neat weapons you came up with for this mobile suit. If I might suggest a 
few things for the Ragnarok and Ascalon. First of all I like that the 
Ascalon beam sword can be used either single or double handed. For any who 
have confusion over the reason for double handed use, it's simple. 
Leverage. You get more leverage using two hands on a longer handle, in 
simple terms you get more damage form the strike. It's why most real world 
swords are designed the way they are when they're made to accommodate two 
hands. The leverage factor carries over to blocking and parrying as well of 
course.

But I do think the Ascalon could benefit from a counter balance. The pure 
energy blade is weightless, if it was say, an anti-beam coated steel blade 
(even a thinner lighter blade than usual anti-ship swords would help) with 
a way of directing the energy around it or down to just it's edges, it 
would be more balanced and handle more similarly to a real sword. I think 
part of what makes anti-ship swords effective in the first place is their 
greater mass than standard beam sabers. When you strike with something with 
proper balance that's been weighted correctly for the intended task and 
accelerate it to a similar speed, it cleaves and cuts deeper into the 
target. There is a balance however, after a certain point the factor of 
inertia and redirecting the force makes it harder to stop a cut and 
redirect into a parry, block, thrust, etc..Witness the Strike Noir's 
blades. They're not exactly over sized, but they have something to add 
balance and mass for more shearing cuts and easier handling. Something 
similar in size to that, but again, a completely different and adjustable 
system as you made clear.

On to the Ragnarok, and I assume this is already included in it's 
capabilities, but what about a rapid fire mode? Sure it's already been 
done, but it would add to it's versatility, making it some what like a beam 
Gatling, which could even adjust down to fire very fine particles to help 
shoot down small mobile armor or incoming missile projectiles. if only to 
help protect other units on the battle field, or give other mobile suits a 
storm of even finer projectiles to get around. I'd imagine the emitters in 
the hands could function similarly. The drawback of course, being depending 
on how high the rate of fire, and the power of the shot being just below a 
standard beam rifle in intensity in this mode would eat a lot of energy 
after awhile, and may cause some serious overheating issues with prolonged 
use. But still, I think it would be a good option, once again, if only for 
versatility. And small bursts of 20-30 shot flurries could be shot with a 
few taps of the trigger to easily dispatch large numbers of smaller 
enemies. .  

I would also assume the design includes a vulcan setting for the hand 
emitters for similar use, and and head mounted vulcans could be made to 
shoot low intensity beam projectiles as they do in Unicorn.

These are just a few of my thoughts, and for the most part I very much like 
your design, it's just that nothing can be truly perfect, I'm sure even 
some of my own ideas have their flaws. I just figured if you cared to read 
through this long ass comment you might like to hear them and maybe garner 
some ideas we could see on a potential Mk-II variant of this suit, or 
others you might decide to create or redesign, the ideas on the sword 
simply come from my own (Negligible and novice)  experience with real 
Historical European Martial Arts and Longsword fencing, as I'd think the 
general physics for damage and balance would still apply somewhat within 
the cockpit of a mobile suit.﻿

opens Shinn's eyes and directs his collected wrath against the "force of

+WackyModder84 Let me point out that I was just making an example - I was, 
as I said before, simply bringing up that in spite of our long arguments, 
you never *convinced* me of anything, nor did I ever convince you.

Second, I again point out that even to this day I disagree and feel you're 
too close to the project to see the flaws in it. My argument was that the 
Arche Destiny had far too many design redundancies to be a practical 
military suit, let alone a successor unit to the Destiny. I pointed out 
that;
- I claimed the thrust system was redundant since Mirage Colloid was proven 
by GSD: Astray to be capable of manipulating air-flows for pulpulsion (it 
was one one of the side-effect features the Astray Gold Frame Amatsu (Model 
number MBF-P01-ReAMATU) and it's "Maga no Ikutachi" Energy Absorbtion 
claws, and Lowe Guele improved this when making the Astray Red Frame's 
Caletvwlch, discovering Mirage Colloid particles could control air-flow and 
resistance, helping the MS to maintain its balance while moving through the 
air or allowing it to remain stationary and hover in the air "with ease." 
It can could even be used to create an air current, propelling the mobile 
suit forward - a detail that may also explain how Geschmeidig Panzer pods 
could use Colloid particles for underwater propulsion. This invalidated 
your belief that Mirage Colloid-based propulsion couldn't function in an 
atmosphere when obviously it could in fact be not only adapted for this but 
operate far better then the conventional thrusters the Arche Destiny uses.
- I claimed the overclocking was redundant because it can abused and 
mismanaged too easily and Shinn as he was in GSD's endgame would never have 
managed himself well enough to balance it before he'd overload it and kill 
himself with it. Giving someone a more complex machine doesn't instantly 
change their character development - Shinn's character would have 
self-destructed no matter what machine he had simply because of 
meta-reasons (the writers abandoning him for Athrun and Kira), and a more 
complex OS would have sped up that self-destruction. SRW Shinn might have 
been a different story, but GSD's mentally-broken endgame Shinn... not so 
much.
- I claimed Flash Edge III was redundant because you could spend the time, 
effort, money, thrusters and computer guidance systems on DRAGOONS instead 
- you may as well build a DRAGOON system for the thing instead of waste the 
money on disposable weapons like the Flash Edge and it's subsequent 
replacements. It would cost more time and money just to develop the things 
in the first place, let alone make them practical.
- I claimed the Ascalon was redundant because of how you tend to need 
multiple emitters arranged in an array to get the Armure Lumiere barrier 
system to form angled shapes, meaning that the hilt alone would need an 
array or framework around or inside it reaching all the way to the blade's 
tip to form the field around in order to even shape a lightwave barrier 
into a blade-like shape to begin with. That alone made the Ascalon's design 
impossible with GSD technology, making it impractical for use even in 
standard beam sabers, let alone a tapered Zweihandar-type weapon like the 
Ascalon. The Arondight was tried, true, effective, replaceable and could do 
the job just as well without using anywhere as much power as your Ascalon 
needed to be both projected and to break through energy shields. 
- I claimed it was a bad move to rely exclusively on Solidus Fulgor because 
we'd seen in Gundam SEED Astray manga that physical blades with an 
anti-beam coating could cut lightwave barriers, as Gui Murakamo proved in 
his Blue Frame against the Gundam Hyperion-3. The Destiny's physical shield 
was akin to a dueling shield meant to parry those kinds of weapons, and I 
also pointed out that said weapons were seen in GS and GSD (Forbidden 
Gundam and it's mass-produced variants had an anti-beam laminated scythe 
and most ZAKU Phantoms carried beam lances that had physical scythes on 
their ends, which I cited as *proof* that physical weapons were in 
practical use among mass-produced units in both ZAFT and the Alliance.)
- I claimed the Ragnarok was impractical outside of being a ship-mounted 
weapon, or a gun-unit for a ZAKU on gunner duty from the deck of a ship 
like what Lunimaria would often do with her machine. The "recharge as the 
barrel changes orientation" means that it would constantly be sapping the 
battery, and all for shots that, in that short time-frame, wouldn't have 
enough condensed energy to match up to the Hyper-Impulse or even the Agni, 
and by constantly sapping the battery like that it wouldn't be any 
different then how the Wings of Light drained it - it would require more 
power then a nuclear reactor could could put out in combat between 
everything else, and the shots would likely have bee individually weaker 
then the Hyper-Impulse. And like the previous weapons, the development, 
maintenance, repair and replacement costs make it an impractical weapon for 
a machine like the Destiny when compared to the Hyper-Impulse. It would 
basically require tech that was not available in GSD to make it practical.
- I claimed the Tombstones were all-around redundant because the Palma 
Fiocina, modified/improvised by Shinn to be a close-range energy flare for 
pseudo-melee, already does their job well enough, acting as a flare of 
concentrated energy. 
- I claimed the "improved" Palma Fiocina is basically redundant to have - 
if you have a rifle, why make this version capable of maintaining it's 
fire-rate? The original served as a short-range weapon and Shinn could 
improvise it as a melee weapon - so why shift the focus like that and force 
the use of two individual weapons to make up for what the original did in 
conjunction with it's beam rifle?
- I claimed the Tachyon.... I mean, between your "improved" Palma Fiocina 
and the Ragnarok, this weapon is also just plain redundant to have, and it 
doesn't function in a way that's much, if any, different from other beam 
rifles. Having just one or the other would be enough.
- I claimed the paint-job and design astethics look more like they're 
taking from the Freedom and Srike Noir (and I point out that I am not the 
only one who made that comparison), and it doesn't look any more "original" 
then the Destiny. 

Like I said, I took not just from Gundam Wiki but from the manga material 
as well, and pointed out that this argument lacked backing because Gundam 
Wiki has *sources* that validate much of it's claims and data. If anything, *little 
to none* of it was "factually incorrect", and I'd like to which parts of

that they are based off of what I researched, chief of these being elements 
from the manga or articles that were sourced from the official material.

Well, to be fair the Epyon did destroy that one asteroid base in one slice, 
but then again most of the structure's in AC were pretty flimsy. Also why I 
said Epyon and not the others is because the beams of the Ascalon and the 
Epyon's sword are both triangular, even if the Epyon's is a bit messier and 
so the image association is there, at least for me. As for the ZZ Hi Mega 
Cannon/ Ragnarok comparison, I was mostly comparing their functionality and 
just happened to be weapon I had in mind as you were explaining the 
Ragnarok full power mode, but you are right there are many dozens of other 
similar weapons. If you insist I compare the Ragnarok with a handheld 
weapon, I suppose the better comparison would be the Hi-Nu Gundam's Hyper 
Mega Bazooka Launcher which needs to be connected to the Ra Cailum itself 
to have enough power to fire and outputs enough power to crack Axis in 
half. I'm not trying to equate any of these weapons with each other, just 
saying that there are comparisons to be made about the functionality of 
these weapons, and do understand that there are critical differences 
between these weapons. Once again good work, and I have one side question, 
do you know of any way to read a translated version of Beltorchika's 
Children?

> *"The Ascalon and Epyon's sword for instance, both are adjustable output 
powered directly by the gundam's reactor that can reach pretty big sizes as 
well"*

That's preposterous. Epyon has a CABLE which directly connects the sword to 
the Gundam's Reactor. And ontop of that. Epyon's Beam Blade is A MESS. It 
has no containment whatsoever, and the Beam Energy just sprays all over the 
place. The Ascalon is a Highly Contained Blade that is designed for 
Anti-Ship / Anti-Mobile Suit Combat. And ontop of that: Epyon's Sword can't 
grow bigger NEARLY to the extend that the Ascalon's can.
And ontop of that. This is NOT the only time mobile suits have used a Saber 
that is connected directly to the reactor.
Can you say *PROVIDENCE GUNDAM*, *GN FLAG* and *GUNDAM X MAOH*??? >_>

> *"Ragnarok max output mode and the ZZ's hi mega cannon, two high powered 
beam cannons that both put stress on the mobile suit's reactor to the point 
that it is inadvisable to fire multiple times."*

Again, may I ask wtf you're talking about?
ZZ's High Mega Cannon is a Beam Cannon in the FOREHEAD of the Gundam
The Ragnarok is a Heavy Weapon that you hold in your HANDS. The two are 
nothing alike whatsoever.
And ontop of that, I can think of DOZENS of other weapons in the Gundam 
Universe that have to be fixed after firing them. XD

But I'm glad you enjoy the Gundam, regardless.

I like this design. Yes, I know some people don't, but I do like it. I like

this, I wish there was a game I could pilot this thing in.﻿

Your voice has a lot of "high tones" and because of that, you are hitting 
the cap. I recommend when recording, going into your microphone settings 
and turning down the volume at which your microphone captures at, thus it's 
going to capture your higher tones without capping out. Remember that if 
your voice comes off as "too soft" you can fix that by increasing the 
volume in the video editor before rendering the video, where as if it's too 
high, the sound is already corrupted and no longer suitable.

Keep in mind if you are using windows, programs and plugins like YouTube 
had a bad habit of changing the active volume. usually increasing them 
without people noticing.﻿

> *"4)okay i get it you got rid of The Voiture Lumiere System but....Does

you need wings of light for thrust??? is there practicality for the wings

- ABSOLUTELY. If we removed the Wings of Light from the Destiny Gundam, 
people would RIOT. It's a trademarked feature of the Destiny Gundam that is 
impossible to take away without making a lot of people upset. All we did 
was just make the Wings of Light LOGICAL and actually MAKE SENSE so that we 
can still keep them.
- No, the Arch Destiny DOES NOT create After Images anymore. But it moves 
so fast that it leaves a Blur behind it from the massive blue thrust 
exhaust sometimes at high speeds.
- Uh...YEAH??? The Wings of Light, as stated in the video, ARE MASSIVE 
THRUSTERS that give the Arch Destiny it's propulsion and high speed. And 
they are also used to keep the Arch Destiny in the air on Earth.
- YA?? Are you telling me the DEFAULT DESTINY's WINGS OF LIGHT are more 
practical than this? Because if you seriously think that, then you need 
your fucking eyes checked, my friend. XD
These Wings are basically GIANT THRUSTERS, again, as stated in the video. 
And they allow the Arch Destiny to achieve INCALCULABLE Speeds. Something 
that the Default Destiny was SUPPOSED TO DO in the first place.
- No, the Wings of Light CANNOT be used as a weapon like the Victory 2 
Gundam. They are too big for that, and that's not what they were intended 
to do in the first place with the Default Destiny. That would be changing 
too much and would be making them a bit more unoriginal. So their primary 
purpose is to give the Arch Destiny HUGE Thrust and Speed.

Dude I'm a big Wing Fanboy but even more of a Heero fanboy, however I'm 
open minded and am fully aware of how flawed Wing is in general. In fact my 
reasoning for being such a big Wing/Heero fanboy is all nostalgia due to 
introducing me to Gundam. I'll admit that I'm a bad critique with anime and 
whatever the Wing Gundam>WZ> WZC's issues are that you'll be pointing out, 
I'm pretty sure I'm ignorant to them, but I hope they are big enough for 
you guys to make a new Wing Zero variant. A few things I wish Wing Zero had 
to be more than a Gundam with precognition and a big fucking beam cannon, 
is for the Twin Buster Rifle to have multiple setting and output options. 

For example, since WZ is equipped with the search eye and ZERO system its 
easy to figure out the potential and weaknesses of its target. So if the 
TBR (twin buster rifle) could some how have a shorter barrel and adjust the 
output on the beams it could work like a beam rifle. Then have some kind of 
attachment or transformable feature to make the barrel longer to be used as 
your typical TBR for wide scale fire power. Another option while having the 
longer barrel is the ability to fire fast skinny beams with higher piercing 
power. This option would be more for extremely long range and is primarily 
used like a sniper. While in this mode the data from the search eye and 
precognition of the ZERO system would take full advantage of sniping a 
target with relative ease. All 3 of these modes serve as methods for 
fighting different types of units more efficiently without having to use 
assumed large amounts of energy per blast from the TBR.

The next thing I feel all 3 Wing variants should have is some kind of 
gimmick or weapon that uses their Wings. When I think of their names and 
the fact they are Gundams, I imagine their wings having more relevance to 
their weaponry than being a visual identification which is all they are. Of 
all the Gundams with wings that actually attack with them is some way, 
Victory Gundam I believe is the only one. Here is a neat idea, I can see 
Wing Gundam and Wing Zero having some kind of beam emitters on the sides of 
the wings that would be useful for a few things. I didn't include Wing Zero 
Custom because I have different idea in mind. Here are some examples. Bird 
Mode and Neo Bird Mode could use their wings to sever enemy units as it 
flies by at high speeds. Thats a useful weapon against multiple targets. 
The next use for it would be during close range combat. While having a beam 
saber covers that, being able to attack with your wings during spinning 
movements while incorporating your standard beam saber combat adds more 
attack options that force the enemy to keep a safe distance if they cant 
handle that kind of close combat. By doing this, (I'm going to use gaming 
terms here) you'll be resetting the neutral game and putting yourself into 
range combat which WZ has the weapons to be an even bigger threat. 

Here is Wing Zero Custom's wing features. Remember those feather thing on 
its angel wings? Now remember the planet defensors AKA the sheild bit like 
things the Mercurius and Virgos used? The feathers are detachable and work 
in the same way as the planet defensors. Here is the next phase of having 
the planet defensors deployed. While the feather bits are deployed WZC has 
a function in that changes what the feather holsters do. While the feathers 
are docked, the wings recharge the energy to deploy the barriers. While 
deployed they can be changed to rapidly fire small beams in the directions 
the wings point to. Now here is where the precognition and calculations of 
the ZERO system take full advantage of its Wing armaments. The armor on the 
surface of the feather bits have reflective beam coating. This allows them 
to reflect and or bounce beams off of them. However the amount of beam 
energy they can tolerate is not that high. Which is why they deploy the 
barriers instead of reflecting all incoming beam attacks. Now the reason 
these feathers take full advantage of the ZERO system's calculations is 
that when the wings fire their rapid beam shots the feathers can position 
themselves and work like mirrors thus changing the path of the beams and 
creating hard to follow firing paths. 

Here are the cons to doing this mirror beam bouncing trick. Another reason 
they deploy the barriers is because reflective beam coating doesn't do shit 
against physical non beam attacks and ballistic based projectiles like 
bullets and missiles which in AC universe bullets and missiles are more 
common than beam weapons. Now having reflective coating and barriers 
doesn't sound like much of a con right? Well here is the thing. The 
barriers have to be off while reflecting the beams otherwise the barriers 
will just stop your beams rather than reflecting them. This leaves them 
vulnerable to attacks and even with reflective beam coating, the beams dont 
have a high tolerance to stronger beams. Not only that, the reflective 
coating is only on one side of the feather bits since that side is 
completely flat allowing better refection paths. The other side cant do 
this since it has multiple small thrusters that it needs to move and 
properly angle itself and this side is also the one that deploys the planet 
defensors. A solution to this problem would be, just give it more feather 
bits that do either reflecting shit or barriers. In theory thats a good 
idea, but I took into consideration that controlling all of those bits is 
probably hard enough since it requires more for the pilot to do already. 
The ZERO System is whats allowing these feats to be done as efficiently as 
they can be. Adding more strain to the pilot by having to control more 
feather bits would be strenuous on the pilot. Thats where the next con 
shows up. In order to even use the feather bits effectively is heavily 
reliant on the ZERO system's help which as we already know, is always 
active in the Wing Zero. So the feather bits are not something that can be 
deployed at all times. The most that the pilot can do without so much 
calculating is just having the feather bits use their planet defensors 
which would be doing 1 task and thats protecting you. The mirror trick 
would be something of a trump card to catch your enemies off guard. If 
Heero were a New-Type which doesn't exist in the AC universe, the mirror 
trick would probably less strenuous since he could control the feather 
"funnels" through thought. But new types dont exist in AC so this is what 
limits this ability. 

I'm sure you and your team could come up with something better and more 
balanced, but I just figured I throw out some ideas.﻿

Where to even start. Well I guess we start with the design.

Yeah, this is basically the Destiny with the Strike Noir's colors. I had 
heard that you tried to make this variant in an attempt to give the Destiny 
its own identity. Well that ship sank faster than an anvil-bound elephant. 
It already lost its "identity" the moment you made this machine a variant. 
It has no identity of its own because it's already based on something else. 
Oh, but it certainly does not just end there, but we'll get to that later.

Let's continue with functionality. Oh god does this thing SUCK. Not even in 
SEED would this thing ever work.

*An overheating beam cannon which presumably does not even have any 
heatsinks, making it completely useless as a pratical firearm.

*An unwieldy, massive beam sword that would end up guzzling energy when 
close ranger weapons in general are made to conserve energy use.
It's not even tied to the machine's reactor, so I'd imagine it'd fizzle out 
in about 10 seconds, being generous.

*Replacing the reliable Phase Shift armor in lieu of an overclocking 
mechanism was just dumb. Without Phase Shift, it's vulnerable to ANYTHING 
and immunity to solid shell weapons is a staple among Gundams. It's one of 
their defining traits and you got rid of it for a stupid system that 
increases the pilot's chances of getting killed by a measly stray shot.

*Increasing the Wings of Light's output so much that they can potentially 
harm the pilot? Well I'm certainly glad you're not designing any real-life 
combat craft since that is one of the most stupid things I ever heard. You 
are  intentionally injuring the pilot for a handicap that's not needed or 
necessary for the sake of "balance" and looking cool.
Here's an idea, dude: fix the cockpit so it can handle those increased G 
forces.

*Making the palm cannons bigger raises issues. What's the point of 
increasing their size? Just to have another beam weapon? Isn't this thing 
eating up enough energy as it is? How is it distributing all of this energy 
to the arms without blowing up considering the beam shields on its arms? 
Was this to make up for the fact that this thing doesn't even have a normal 
firearm like a beam rifle or something? Speaking of which, why does this 
thing not have a more pratical firearm it can fall back on for small fry? 
Why did you add steel pikes when the palm cannons are suppose to serve that 
function already?

*The only thing on your machine that works are the thruster-powered beam 
boomerangs but I'd wager having to add engines on those small weapons just 
causes greater weight and arm calibration issues. I'm surprised with the 
weapons its carrying, its arms haven't fallen off yet. At least the Red 
Frame can get away with carrying around a ridiculously huge sword with the 
excuse of using specialized equipment to carry it around. This thing 
doesn't even have that excuse.

What you have here is a glass cannon without the advantages of it being a 
glass cannon. It's just glass. Unnecessary replacements that do more harm 
than good. No conventional weaponry to rely on. No regards for weight or 
energy issues and overall, absolutely no combat practicality. This is an 
even worse coffin than an effin' TIE Fighter because it's practically 
designed to kill the pilot if they actually try to fight their best. It 
craps on Shinn's fighting style rather than actually complimenting it.
-------------------------------------------------------
But let's return to the main concern of this machine: the fact that you 
tried to make this machine different and failed hard at it.

All you did was replace the Destiny's equipment with bigger versions of the 
stuff it already had, so you made absolutely no attempt at removing the 
references you derided the original Destiny having. No, you didn't do just 
that. Merely, you replaced references with others and I think you actually 
added more, too. So let's tear through this, using your own logic against 
you.

*The beam cannon is a blatant ripoff of the GN Beam Cannons found on the 
Gadessa and Gadeleza. Triple barrel beam cannon weapon that overheats upon 
usage. Except it doesn't have heatsinks. ... You know what happened to the 
AGE-3's haphazard addition to the Sigmaxiss beam cannon? It blew up. That's 
what this thing'll do, too.

*The beam sword is an obvious rip off of Epyon's beam sword. Same design 
and comparative output. The only thing you took away, the most practical 
thing about it, was the cord empowering the weapon in the first place.

*The Overclock is an obvious reference to the original Trans-AM. Powers up 
the machine for several seconds before deactivating and taking much of the 
machine's original performance with it. SO UNIQUE.

*You still kept in the Shining Finger from the Shining Gundam. You just 
made it bigger. What.

*The Wings of Light are a reference to Moonlight Butterfly? Are you trying 
to to play your audience for fools? Not only did you shamelessly keep in 
two references, but you actually got THIS one wrong. The Moonlight 
Butterfly does not even provide greater thrust. It's solely an offensive 
weapon. It's just a bunch of glowing nanites that om nom everything in its 
general vicinity. Neither yours nor the original Destiny did that. They're 
just large amounts of energy condensed into the shape of wings that make 
the machine go faster. And you're suppose to be a Gundam guru?

I can't believe this at all. You spent over an agonizing 30 minutes whining 
about how the Destiny Gundam is such a big ripoff of previous works yet 
here you are, spending an excruiating HOUR droning about how great and 
oh-so original your variant is when it rips off even more stuff? The fact 
that people actually take you seriously leads me to believe you yourself 
have a cult because no sane person actually taking a look at this thing 
would think this is even remotely original. You're a hypocrite of the 
extreme kind and I despise that.﻿

Not gonna lie. I found this video out of pure boredom, and even more 
boredom saw to it that I actually started watching it. Even still, it's 
been an amusing diversion. I had always thought the Destiny was a bit 
asinine both in design and usage, so this is a pretty warranted take on it, 
I figure. The Destiny always seemed like it was trying (and failing) to do 
what the Freedom, and later Strike Freedom, had been succeeding at the 
entire time: being an all purpose mobile suit with ridiculous amounts of 
versatility. The fact that Shinn was apparently horrifyingly inept as a 
pilot didn't exactly help matters, either. Dude got his ass beat by Kira 
while the latter was using a technologically inferior, outdated mobile suit 
(namely the Freedom). Comes back repaired, fights him AGAIN, and nearly 
gets the Impulse destroyed. Only real reason he was able to take down the 
Freedom was Kira being a little bitch. .. Whoops, did I type that? I meant 
his constant hesitation. Bearing all this in mind, there is one thing 
missing from your Destiny redesign: an anti-retard system. Anybody that 
can't even beat Kira Yamato without multiple huge handicaps probably should 
just stay away from both mobile suits and the human genome. >_> But alas, 
some technologies will forever be beyond the reach of man Overall, though, 
I'd say I like what you and various artists appear to have done with the 
mobile suit design both in terms of aesthetics and functionality.﻿

I will give you props for updating the Destiny and making it unique.
BUT I have one and only one main complaint.  That complaint is the power.  
The reactor only produces power and you are stating the power supply as if 
it is both a power generator and a power storage system.

My personal complaint is that there are to many transforming/moving parts 
in the ... M7000X "Ragnarok" Revolving Positron Cannon. Not only does it 
revolve akin to a Gatling gun but it extends to increase the firepower. I 
can easily imagine that weapon alone having almost as many moving parts as 
the whole mobile suit.
I think limiting the power would be a less complicated result. The weapon 
could be big, with two grips standard but with two modes of fire, single 
shot and tri-shot. This would reduce the moving parts, improve the 
structural integrity of the weapon and slightly reduce the cost. OR the 
weapon could be on a moveable platform that is directly connected to the 
suit's reactor, offering three energy connection points.

This is my personal philosophy but I absolutely hate gatling energy 
weapons. Multi-barreled energy weapons are fine but once the barrel/emitter 
starts revolving all bets are off (Electronic weapon VS chemical energy 
weapon, both operate on very different design principles). To me it is a 
weird attempt to look cool.

This is why I am a fan of the AGE 3's SigMaxiss Rifle. A simple, large, and 
powerful rifle. No bells, no whistles but a lot of firepower.﻿

Wacky, I have a UC-related question. Do you know more detailed info 
regarding the propulsion system they used *before the introduction of the 
Minovsky Craft System (Penelope and Xi), Minovsky Flight (Victory) and the 
Minovsky Drive (V2)?*

In my opinion based on my research (although rushed), before 100 UC, they 
use rocket & vernier thrusters, which are either chemical rockets or ion 
thrusters in nature since they use conventional propellants (which are also 
probably inert as well)

Also, according to Mark Simmons in his site 
http://www.ultimatemark.com/gundam/power.html 
UC MS are equipped with nuclear thermal rocket engines, in which propellant 
is heated by the reactor and then expelled to create thrust. These devices 
provide substantially greater fuel efficiency than chemical rocket engines, 
allowing the mobile suit to operate for longer periods and reach higher 
velocities in space.

Hey Wacky, not sure if you noticed, but I thought I should mention this 
just in case no one else did as it simply stood out to my eyes. Did you all 
notice during development that the Arch Destiny very slightly references 
the Zudah and the Double Zeta? I say the Zudah because the whole "Max the 
output and your ass is grass" feature was the main theme behind it. 
(Although thankfully the Arch Destiny wont just go "boom" on the spot when 
maxed out.) As for the ZZ, the idea of the generator being massively 
drained to the point that it gives the pilot a combat disadvantage was used 
with the ZZ's High Mega Cannon. If you recall it left the ZZ almost useless 
because the generator was drained almost dry. The Arch Destiny is left at 
about 50% after firing the beam cannon at max so it's not as bad, but 
combine that with maxing another one of its weapons and it might be left in 
a state similar to the ZZ's. It just stood out to me so I felt I should 
mention it, If somebody else already did I apologize as I am always late to 
the party. Oh, and congratulations! You and your team have accomplished 
greatness. (Side Note: Is there any chance that you will make a mobile 
armor video?)﻿

I gotta give credit where credit is due, I do like it quite a bit. While 
initially it seemed like it might've been oversold in terms of the quality, 
it's the weapons systems that really got me behind the Arch Destiny, as 
well as the recurring theme of self-control.

Though I have to say that I have a few minor nitpicks.:
- The "Two Gundams" inspiring it might be true, but I also noticed 
Tallgeese (as you stated), 00 Raiser (with the overclocked Ascalon), and 
Alt Eisen (the Tombstones). Not anything major. The Tallgeese inspiration 
ties in with the Arch Destiny (and it works better here I think). Also, the 
Alt Eisen weapon might have been unintentional, but just tossing that out 
there.
- If the beam sabers use a shielding of Armure Lumiere, shouldn't they have 
the light blue-green color of the barrier rather than the pink color? 
Although now that I say that, I realize that it's possible the shell of 
particles is so thin that it probably wouldn't alter the color.
- This last one is actually not what I'd think is a "nitpick," just my 
putting two cents into a way to make the weapons more practical: I think it 
would be a good idea to allow the individual weapons to hold charges 
without needing to be hooked up to the Palma Fiocina. The main reason for 
them not to be able to do so is on the off-chance that someone manages to 
get their hands on one of the weapons, which is a rare occurrence in 
battle. However, if you weighed the pros and cons of that and figured that 
it's not worth risking, I can get it. I still think that at the very least 
the Ragnarok being able to hold a charge would be a good idea. The 
Ragnarok, after all, is built into the Gundam, making it unlikely to be 
something that would be disarmed. For example of the possibility here: if 
you could, directly before a battle, charge up the overclocked mode most of 
the way and then finish the charge in the battle (even if some of the 
charge might have degraded over time just by virtue of not being used), you 
could manage to get that Tannhauser-level shot off with a much lower power 
drain in-battle. It wouldn't just be a surprise to the opponent to see such 
a massive blast from out of nowhere, but imagine the psychological effect 
of seeing a Mobile Suit fire off a battleship class beam cannon and then 
continue to fight like that massive blast was no big deal!﻿

Ah, you see that right there is an Excellent Question. Here's the deal, 
though. Thrusters in the Cosmic Era, how unfortunate it is for me to say 
this, are just *One Massive Gray Area* for a large variety of Mobile Suits. 
Have you ever wondered what kind of thrusters could *possibly* be on C.E. 
Mobile Suits that are equipped with Ultracompact Batteries as Power 
Sources?  If you look into it, almost 80% of Mobile Suits in the Cosmic Era 
who are not Nuclear Powered have their Propulsion Systems labeled as 
"Unknown", and for good reason. It's physically impossible to have an

> *"I can get your point, but what you said about "Horribly Inaccurate" I

It's true, though. GundamWiki is KNOWN for having God-Awfully Inaccurate 
Articles regarding specific information like this. All they are is 90% 
Assumption-Based. Why the hell do you think I never ever use them as a 
reference with my rants? Simple. Because their articles are not credible, 
are assumption-based, and can literally be edited by anyone.
OFFICIAL SOURCES such as Gundam Fact File and Gundam Encyclopedia are the 
ones to look at, since they contain the BARE FACTS from Sunrise and Bandai 
themselves, and are not editable by anyone.

As for your other theory about the Destiny and Legend's reactors. I looked 
and looked and looked for over 3 HOURS last night to try and find official 
shit on that. And I came up with absolutely nothing. I also checked some of 
the fan debates on this topic, and it turns out that the Destiny and Legend 
using "Deuterion Batteries" was one of the most popular Common 
Misconceptions back in 2004-2006, that was long-since used as an excuse to 
try and damage control the Destiny. Morita Shigeru, one of the mecha 
designers of SEED, said in an Interview once that Hyper Deuteron means that 
it uses a Nuclear Reactor AND Deuteron. But this is a common misconception 
that most people believe means "Reactor + Battery". Basically, it's a 
Hybrid Reactor. There are two energy sources in the Destiny and Legend, but 
that doesn't mean they work separately from each other as both a Battery 
AND a Reactor. That's the misconception here.

So yeah, dude. That whole "Deuterion Battery" thing is just a massively 
overused common misconception. Sorry. =\

+WackyModder84 I can get your point, but what you said about "Horribly 
Inaccurate" I cannot agree. I checked before I ask you. Why I follow the 
Batteries thing is because...

On the all cases of the show where we see a Power Indicator, they show 
Hyper-Capacitor. Hyper-Capacitors in a nutshell is a battery that is 
capable of transferring electricity in and out of it quickly. Also why I 
agree on the fact that they use Batteries/Hyper-Capacitors is because that 
is the best way to be energy efficient.

I mean if you think about it, the Gundam's energy consumption rates will 
vary greatly. Say when it is just flying, making maneuvers, shooting a 
laser from its beam rifle, shooting a laser from Beam Cannon or ya, making 
quick maneuvers AND shooting a laser from its beam rifle AND Beam cannon... 
also I think the energy consumption rate would be different taking on a 
slower weaker and less adept Pilot than dealing with other Ace pilots on 
comparable robots. So having Batteries can ensure that you have an extra 
energy source to draw power from when the energy consumption rate spikes up 
from fighting.. Nuclear Reactors can only be drained if they are pushed to 
nuclear explosion scale of energy overload... In fact it is even possible 
to tune a Reactor to use the Nuclear waste material as a fuel.

So with the fact that they bothered to write down Primary and Secondary 
Hyper-Capacitors in Destiny's Power Indicator says that they have batteries 
in them. 

Also from what I can tell about Deuterion/Deuterium energy tech base off 
Impulse received a Deuterion Beam from its mothership.. it is basically a 
compressed laser of energy used to charge batteries at super fast speed 
since Impulse went from critical to full almost instantly.

CMS-01 Transient: a prototype MS, moved to a limited-production status

"transient armor system," a way to switch armor (like striker packs, or the

I can't anwser your first question but I can the second. A covenat is like 
a pact, its a two way deal between people one individual promises to 
provided something usually a service and gain some sort of reward in return 
usually money or a valuable item. For example a warrior dealing with a lord 
of an area of land making a pact to defend said land in exchange for a 
small portion of land, money, perhaps a sword or such.
A good example would be the covenants from the dark souls games. The 
sunlight warriors covenant for example make a deal to essentially help out 
other plays with bosses and upon helping another player are rewarded with a 
sunlight metal which can be exchanged for a powerful in game ability.

+WackyModder84 At the same time though, it's still impossible to ACTUALLY 
say "it's meaningless" or "it's impossible." The Destiny is what I call a 
rare "lore-void" suit - there is no lore definitively disproving it's 
ability to exist, but nothing that definitively validates it's existence 
either. It just... exists. Like I said, your cardinal sin of suit designs 
is, I think, having something just exist with nothing available to prove 
either way of thinking over the other - basically a "reverse plot-hole" : 
something that, instead of invalidating existing cannon, simply exists 
without any reason for it to cannonacly do so. Existence without actual 
defined reason.

 You and I could likely fight till the end of time and never find any 
conclusive proof to validate either belief - it will still just be sitting 
there in that void between "lore-supported" and "lore-breaking." There are 
reasons that can logically explain it... but they can never be validated, 
so it amounts to speculation. Personally, I don't think you would hate the 
suit if, or would at least hate it less, if it's inner workings weren't 
reliant on educated guesswork to figure out. Instead, it exists like 
Stonehenge (at least in the early days of research) - it's there, and 
there's plenty to explain it, but nothing that dose so conclusively.

+MrCreepjo Genius in terms of reaction time and snap thinking - but that's 
not the same thing as micromanagement of multiple complex sub-weapons. It's 
the fundamental difference between a pilot who can use DRAGOON's and one 
who can't - Shinn always seemed to flourish the LESS he was given to work 
with, because he worked conservatively and made the most out of every trick 
and tool he had. He took simple tools and refined them over time - he 
accelerate l ed in practical fighting rather then complex micro-system use 
like with the DRAGOON's and opted for more straightforward but effective 
fighting. 

That'd different from the kind of "genius" that Kira was, in that rather 
then being just a snap-thinker, Kira was highly-intelligent in all fields 
and could formulate attack plans on contact with the enemy. Shiny is a 
"genius" practical soldier, while Kira is a "genius" theoretical operator. 
One works with more practical tools and the other is capable of abstract 
multitasking of multiple systems.

+WackyModder84 That was because his beliefs started collapsing - Kira was 
discovered to be alive in the next battle, the siege of ORB, and so was 
Athrun. Thre was the guilt of what (or so he assumed) he did to Meryin, 
having Athrun pick at his reasons for fighting, doubt in his own confidence 
with Athrun and Kira's survival, and finally, his formally resolved PTSD 
coming back in full force when he felt that he'd failed Stella by being 
unable to avenger her due to Kira still being alive, and then Athrun 
throwing said PTSD memories in his face every chance he got - it all adds 
up.

However, I'm drawn a bit to Athrun's actions playing a big role in it . IDK 
if Athrun was trying to destabilise Shinn or persuade him, but if it's the 
latter, Athrun did a crap job of it - news flash: people are easier to 
reason with if you DON'T make them angry and mentally unstable with 
constant prodding. Athrun really could have made a better, more structured 
argument - as it was, Athrun's argument sounded more like he was just 
calling Shinn an angry brat rather then actually giving a valid reason WHY 
Shinn ought to feel differently or WHY he should or shouldn't feel this 
way. In my experience, telling somebody they're wrong "because they're 
angry" is more likely to miss someone off as opposed to saying "you're 
angry for the wrong reason." It just felt like Athrun was focused more on 
Shinn being angry then the reason WHY Shinn was angry - as though the 
reason didn't have anything to do with it. Add to that the fact that he 
pretty much accused Shinn of being a soldier just to spite ORB and kept 
dragging up his old ghosts in just about the bluntest way he could, and... 
well, it doesn't help a mental state.

Basically, I think Athrun's bungled attempt to "rationalize" with Shinn 
could have played a big part in it - to me, it's like watching a sane man 
(Shinn) be stuck in a mental asylum (GSD's roundabout and one-sided 
thinking) and slowly go nuts from nobody giving him one single clear answer 
or any form of emotional support to cope with (Lunamaria did back-up to 
really relieve Shinn's worries outside of just being a presence beside him, 
when she logically ought to have been providing a more grounded support and 
show real merit as both a character and love interest for Shinn if they 
were going to persist on that route). Shinn is actually my idea of how a 
lot of realistic characters would react in illogical one-sided storylines - 
they would break from being unable to comprehend the rational of just why 
this war is happening. Shinn is what I believe embodies how someone 
watching GSD feels when they try to comprehend the endgame's plot and the 
Three Ships Alliance's actions - they rage and say "fuck it - I'm just 
getting this over with!"

gonna be a problem.

I love the Arch Destiny. This Gundam fixes everything wrong with the 
Destiny. I do like the Destiny but I also have a big problem with the lack 
of wing articulation, something I only noticed when I built the model. I 
also never understood Shin Finger, as the Palma Fiocina is supposed to be a 
beam weapon. Thinking about upgrading the Destiny one of my ideas was to 
use them to charge weapons, so I'm really happy you also thought of the 
most obvious use for them and incorporated that into the Arch Destiny. I 
was always a little ticked that the Destiny team in its ultimate laziness 
simply took one of the Freedom's original concept designs and gave it to 
Shin. I never understood why the Aerondite (please forgive any misspelling) 
was an upgrade over the dual Excaliburs. However your explanation in the 
Destiny rant explained a lot of the messed up science of the series to me 
and  why anti ship swords are a bad idea to begin with. I also never knew 
about the problem with beam sabes in CE.

I love the color scheme you chose, but I do miss the bloody tears. 
Something about that spoke to the evil nature of the Destiny. I do respect 
your decision to remove them as this takes Shin in a forward direction so 
perhaps the tears would not fit with this Gundam.

I am patiently awaiting your Strike Freedom rant. I happen to love the 
Freedom and Strike Freedom, though I have my own problems with the Strike 
Freedom, like why it doesn't have the ability to swap wing packs from Super 
Dragoon space wings to the original atmospheric wings. Had it been able to 
do that the Strike Freedom's appearance at the Second Battle of Orb would 
have been far more dramatic. I'd like to know what is wrong with the 
Gundam, and also what you think of the Freedom by comparison. I'm not as 
immersed in the science of Gundam as I am simply a fan of the show, but I 
enjoy learning about and understanding it. That's why I enjoyed your 
Destiny and Arch Destiny videos so much and look forward to your ripping 
apart my favorite Gundam, the Strike Freedom. Does that make me a masochist?

I am a fan of CE who totally understands why you hate Kira Yamato. The 
writers messed up royally with the whole ressurection thing, and they did 
it with four other characters as well (including Athrun and Meryn along 
with Waltfeld and Mu). That's lazy, which basically summarizes all the 
problems with CE in one word. But I do like him and would like to see his 
second Gundam redesigned to make sense. I don't know enough technical 
information to be of much help in the discussions, but I can provide some 
intelligent perspective from a fan of the character and the Gundam if you 
do chose to go ahead and redesign it to make.

As for CE in general, I'm not a nitpicker, I just enjoy the show. I suspend 
disbelief because I love the music and the Mobile Suits. CE falls short of 
its potential, but it's still fun to me. As for all the flame wars going on 
pro and con, I don't get that at all. But then, that's the internet for 
you, a place where people think they can change your opinion on everything 
by simply saying "your wrong" followed by a bunch of nasty names.

Those are my thoughts. Thanks for doing this. I wish the show runners had 
half the sense you do when it comes to application of Gundam science, 
especially their own. Such a shame.﻿

I have to say, it's a well thought out and engineered design. I always did 
wondered why those wings weren't articulated. 

Not only that, but the whole overclocking and manual control of said output 
does have symbolic storytelling potential. It's as if the design is telling 
Shin that he has to have a cool head and reign in his rage unless 
absolutely necessarily or else his aimless emotions will get the better of 
him and put him in a world of trouble, if not his wellbeing and ultimately 
his life. It's the kind of storytelling that is noticeably rare in real 
robot anime. Super robot anime, on the otherhand, rather plentiful as far 
as I figure.﻿

Overall I think this is a very well designed variant. Very logically built, 
for the most part. The only nitpicks I have (aside from Mr. Wacky having NO 
INDOOR VOICE to the point that I had to adjust my speakers treble settings 
XD) is with the Ragnarok cannon. Specifically, to do with stowage, 
retrieval, and how it is wielded.

EXHIBIT A: 
http://s1306.photobucket.com/user/WackyModder84/media/Arch%20Destiny%20Gundam/ZGMF-X71TArchDestinyBack_zpsec570376.png.html?sort=3&o=16
We can see here at the top of the "backpack" a slot where, presumably, the 
cannon is stowed. This is presumably connected to the ridged protrusion 
from the back of the folded cannon, viewable on image 1 of :
EXHIBIT B:
http://s1306.photobucket.com/user/WackyModder84/media/Arch%20Destiny%20Gundam/M7000XTBRagnarokCanonActivationSequence_zpse0729c2f2_zps27d2caf0.png.html?sort=3&o=6

Assuming that is the case, then when the cannon half-unfolds so that it can 
be more easily reached, the clamp/cuff where the arm fits in is now further 
away from the arms than before. This isn't necessarily prohibitive of 
operation, however, as one arm could grab it and then turn it around to fit 
it on the other arm. That said it does complicate the usage of the cannon. 
Again, though, nitpick.

As for how it is wielded, see:
EXHIBIT C: 
http://s1306.photobucket.com/user/WackyModder84/media/Arch%20Destiny%20Gundam/destiny_gundam__by_aiusrequiem-d7drnzf_zps672a4da3.jpg.html?sort=3&o=3
Now, it seems pretty straightforward. The arm fits into the brace for 
support while the hand holds the grip and trigger. But there's something of 
an issue:
EXHIBIT D: 
http://s1306.photobucket.com/user/WackyModder84/media/Arch%20Destiny%20Gundam/BLU_zps5e76afaf.png.html?sort=3&o=8
and EXHIBIT E: 
http://s1306.photobucket.com/user/WackyModder84/media/Arch%20Destiny%20Gundam/10151472_758151540876586_677756367_n_zpsb0e2e599.jpg.html?sort=3&o=4
The "gauntlet" armor which contains the Tombstone. It's in the way. The 
square brace for the arm very visibly doesn't account for that gauntlet in 
Exhibit E, where it is fitted very closely to the arm proper: so unless the 
gauntlet can be shifted away from the arm to make room, the brace won't fit 
over the arm.

That said, again, nice redesign/variant!﻿

You said that the Arch Destiny only drew reference from the V2 and 
(unintentionally) the AGE-4, but I would disagree. It also takes reference 
from various other suits:
Gundam Epyon: The Ascalon's massive beam blade.
Gundam 00/Quanta/: The Ascalon's ability to increase the size of the beam 
blade to an enormous size.
Every Suit in the A.D. era with a Solar Reactor: The ability to send energy 
directly from the reactor to the weapons. Overclocking is also similar to 
the Trans AM system.
Strike Noir: The color scheme and shape of the wings.
Tallgeese: The thrusters that you yourself pointed out.
The Gadleaza: The Ragnarok is similar to the Gadelaza's massive beam cannon 
in terms of use and its need to vent itself to prevent overheating. This 
can also apply to Wing Zero (Regular&Custom), the GM Sniper's beam rifle, 
and the rifle of that Zaku Sniper in Unicorn with its need for the latter 
(in some aspects).
Enact: The Tombstones bear a slight resemblance to the Enact's dagger.
The beam rifle still comes off as redundant (as you stated) due to the 
inclusion of the Palma Fiocina's and the Ragnarok, which can fire just as 
fast as the beam rifle and, are in fact more powerful than the beam rifle, 
correct? Also, the Wings of Light were an optional ability that Shinn could 
use to increase propulsion and leave behind a plethora of afterimages to 
confuse the enemy, similar to the F91. The propulsion was also increased 
via the thruster on the back of the original suit.
I know you and everyone mentioned in this video tried their hardest to make 
this Gundam as original as possible, but in my opinion, you failed in that 
regard. What you did not fail in however, was the construction of a pretty 
cool Gundam all in all. I really do think this Gundam is a sight to behold 
and I will give you and everyone else who worked on this credit where it is 
due, but seriously man, we all know that there were a lot of things that 
SEED Destiny did wrong and that the Destiny Gundam was unoriginal however, 
that doesn't mean that it was bad. If you were to say that every Gundam 
that took multiple references from other Gundams were piles of scrap then, 
almost every Gundam in the franchise would fall under that category, 
including this Gundam. Lastly, its been over ten years since the original 
Destiny Gundam was designed. I can't help but feel that this is merely self 
indulgence on your part saying to Sunrise: "Ha! We can totally make a 
Gundam that's better than yours!" and that's truly pathetic on your part. 
It makes you no different than a schoolyard bully, picking on others for 
their "mistakes".
With that said, I do commend you for the level of detail you all put into 
the suit's design, and its weapons. I wish you a good day, sir.﻿

Hey Mr. Wacky, first just wanna say the Arch Destiny is pretty fuckin 
baller, you guys did a great job. Secondly, little bit of criticism that 
really bothered me but most people probably wont care about. The Ragnarok 
looks really cool and the revolving design seems great, but there's simply 
no way it could be both a hyper impulse beam cannon and a positron cannon. 
Now the reason for that is fairly complicated but bear with me.

Firstly, positron beams are not particle beams like the other beam weapons 
in cosmic era like a lot of people think, quite the opposite actually. 
Positrons are the antimatter version of electrons, this is why positron 
cannons are so powerful. When a positron beam hits anything with electrons 
in it (a.k.a. any matter) both the positrons and electrons are completely 
annihilated, leaving only some gamma radiation behind (as a side note this 
is why Captain Ramius got all pissy at Badgiruel in SEED when she wanted to 
use the Lohengrin in the atmosphere, using a positron cannon in atmosphere 
irradiates the environment).

The First problem this causes is that the Ragnarok would have to be almost 
twice as big as you show it to be, as the standard barrel and firing 
structure of the weapon for the standard hyper impulse beams would explode 
if you tried to run positrons through it, so you'd need twice as many 
components to handle both firing types.

The second problem this causes is a matter of where you get the positrons 
from. Advanced warships like Archangel classes and Minerva classes most 
likely utilize an antimatter reactor for power, one was designed in the 
presence of N-jammers and one was built under the treaty of junius which 
prohibited nuclear reactors from being used. These antimatter reactors 
would be where they got the positrons from. What this means is that to use 
the Ragnarok as a positron cannon you would first have to completely 
redesign the Arch Destiny around an antimatter reactor instead of its 
deutirion nuclear reactor, which would make you need to increase the size 
of the Arch Destiny by about 50% to do, if it were any bigger you would 
have to call it the Destroy Arch Destiny or the Psycho Arch Destiny. And 
finally the Ragnarok would have to be connected directly to the reactor and 
not with the Palma Fiocina to stop the positron energy from having to 
travel through the Arch Destiny's arm (which would cause the arm to 
explode).

That concludes my nitpicky science rant. Like I said still love the Arch 
Destiny even if using the Ragnarok might blow it up :)   ﻿

Man this thing looks great and I love the thruster wings they make so much 
more sense.  Also the ragnarok does indeed look amazing as well and it

good as an anti-ship sword.  The palm cannons are looking fine, but one 
question lingers in my mind did the cosmic era have a automatic beam gun.  
I have only ever seen them fire one beam shot at a time rifle style.  Also 
Pile drivers I love them wish they were used in more mecha's. 

Now for a little bit of criticism hope you don't mind.  I like the fact you 
made the the boomerangs in such a way that they can transform into normal 
beam sabers, I also like that you fixed it so it makes sense for it to fly 
and return to you in space because it bothered me too.  Unfortunately I 
still think the boomerangs make no sense, considering that the half that is 
made of beams would offer no aerodynamic properties.  Essentially the 
boomerangs don't look like they would work on earth, they would probably 
not even be good as throwing daggers.  I would have thought it would look 
more like an actual solid boomerang that folds and the beam would just 
cover the edges as soon as it is thrown, then when it returns and gets 
close enough to the thrower it would turn off the beam allowing safe 
catching. 

As for the Ascalon, can I assume the second attachable handle has 
additional, cooling systems and energy control tech to increase max 
overclocking operation time?  Otherwise it would make no sense for it to 
extend the max time limit, if anything you would think overclocking with 2 
hands would shorten operation time.

As for the ragnarok, well this point has sort of bothered me about beam 
weapons in mecha in general.  Why do beams have recoil?  You would think 
considering it has almost no mass and its just an energy weapon that well 
logically it would have no recoil.  Unless it was a plasma weapon and not a 
beam weapon in which case the weapon is misnamed.  I am gonna assume mecha 
show just does it to make things look bad ass.  Still I like the fact that 
you need to use the thrusters to keep yourself from being knocked back by a 
full power shot, it reminds me of the X-burner attack from hitman reborn 
sort of.

I found that I like the idea of this overclock system.  I particularly like 
that you weren't tempted to turn this system into a ultimate power boost 
with no drawbacks, like many people would want to do. It's a nice risk 
reward system.  For as much shit that the trans-am gets, at least by the 
people I know, I like the fact that after trans-am time runs out the gundam 
is left with decreased performance for sometime.  Honestly unless its a 
super robot show I don't like power up systems with no drawbacks.  Speaking 
about super robot shows glad domon and master asia get their shining finger 
back from shin, now if they can only get it back from aquarion.

Overall, I really like the Arch destiny gundam it really great.  Good job 
guys.﻿

Wacky, this is such a BAD-ASS Gundam and I am proud to have subscribed to 
you. When I noticed Max-Output mode on the Ragnarok, I kinda got a 
reference from it that isn't from Gundam. The reference I got was from a 
Kamen Rider show called Kamen Rider Kabuto.

Kabuto has multiple forms/Masked which is the form he first appears in when 
he transforms, Rider Form where he casts off the Masked armor to reveal a 
more lighter armor-set and with a thing called the Hyper Zector, he can go 
into Hyper Form. Hyper Form also has a weapon called the Perfect Zector 
which can use the powers of the Drake, Sasword, & TheBee Zectors from the 
other 3 riders in Kabuto to power the Perfect Zector. The Arch Destiny's 
Ragnarok reminded me immediately of the Perfect Zector's Gun Mode. The 
recoil on the Gun Mode is so massive, Kabuto has to activate Hyper Clock-Up 
to slow it down.

Clock-Up is a function on all riders from Kabuto where once you activate 
it, normal time slows down to a crawl and you move around at near-light 
speed for about 20 seconds. HYPER Clock-Up is essentially God Mode AKA the 
slow-down makes everything look like a picture frame/Not moving at all. 
Hyper Clock-Up can also travel through time itself at the user's want, 
hence why I said God Mode. And with the recoil on the Perfect Zector's Gun 
Mode, you'd want to have Hyper Clock-Up online too unless you want your 
body to become paste on the ground.

Gundam 3 FX A-Funnels type Equipment. In all the Gundams I have seen, we 
can put them into categories, so that they don't seem to be reference to 
each others. These categories are:
   1. The Normal Gundams: These Gundams are Gundams with, well, look like 
the RX-78 Gundam. It has a thruster on it's back, a gun and a beam saber. 
Other Gundam with this kind of thruster on it's pack is put in this kind of 
category. A normal Gundam
   2. Transformable Gundam: These Gundams have the Zeta Gundam as the lead, 
they can transform between air fighter and Mobile Suit for easily adapt to 
situations in the battle field.
   3. Winged Gundam: Any Gundam with a thrusters that look like Wings on 
it's back are put in this category. The have the V2 as an example.
   4. Special Gundams: These Gundams can switch between Normal mode and 
Destroy/Super mode. God Gundam is the leader of this category. (Note: 
Unicorn Gundam can also be put in this category for it can switch modes)
What do you think about this idea. In this case, any Gundam that will 
appear later with the same technology can be put into category like this so 
they don't reference from each other.﻿

Gave the Gundam a look, the effort you've put into its development is 
stunning, and I do agree with the other video, the Destiny isn't exactly a 
Gundam that sat right with me, never liked its aesthetics, or its design, 
or even its weapons. For me, my thoughts on originality is that everything 
bumps into everything else at some point so go ahead and go all out but 
make sure you have enough to tell yourself from everyone else, something 
the Destiny failed in. That said, my thoughts on the mobile suit itself.

I like the thrusters, they're simple, efficient, and the articulation does 
address one of my shticks with the Destiny, and if the Sinanju teaches 
people anything, who needs some fancy gimmick like after-images or 
beam-blades when all you need is to be fast enough to completely trash 
people before they can react?

Weapons-wise I find the concept of having variable settings and unique 
hand-plugs to prevent enemy use as interesting, as was my surprise at the 
fact CE suits have really crappy beam sabers, that's news to me.

The Palma Fiocinas being what they should be is good, a ranged weapon, not 
another melee weapon, because at some point I just thought, "Gee, anyone 
ever wonder if Shinn liked jamming his hand into people's faces why didn't 
they just stick beam sabers in them instead?" They remind me of the Doven 
Wolf's palm-mounted beam cannons, though at some point I'm pretty sure 
Bandai has stuck beam-weapons to every possible part of a mobile suit's 
anatomy.

The Tachyon variable settings are something I've felt many mobile suits 
have needed for a very long time, before UC got theirs in the form of the 
VSBR, I'm just surprised they never caught on to the idea sooner. Back to 
the Tachyon, part of me is curious though if to account for most of the 
things that appear in CE, it possibly needs a setting for high firing rate, 
for those really annoying high-speed mobile suits like the Freedom. (That's 
what the Palma Fiocina's fast shots are for I know, but I generally think 
it usually helps to have an extra.)

Nothing much to say about the melee weapons though definitely a good thing 
they've had 'standard beam saber functionality' added now, I imagine the 
Ascalon's overclock being an 'insurance' for when people try to move out of 
its range, then it gets fired up mid-swing and someone who thinks they're 
out of range is in for a literal scrapping.

The Ragnarok's revolving barrels are a fresh change from the standard 
oversized long cannon, though I'm a fan of really big guns, CE ones aren't 
really my thing (The exceptions are the Duel's bazooka and the Buster's 
guns.). That Positron Cannon though, does it poke any fun at the Blue 
Frame's Lohengrin? And how far will items fly if Mu tanks the positron shot 
with the Akatsuki and fails to die again?

The only thing I feel this gent is missing are a pair of sub-arms, might be 
handy to have a sub-arm that can fire the Ragnarok, possibly over or under 
the shoulder to keep the arms free, or act as an extra brace for the main 
arms when the positron cannon is primed, possibly with a side of rocket 
anchors to tether the unit down to something for more stability when 
firing. Though how to fit that without clashing with the wings, I didn't 
think of, so I apologize if it sounds like odd rambling from me.

All in all though, it's a well-thought out design, not every day you see 
the time and effort taken into developing a custom unit so cheers.﻿

blade from extending past the Arch Destiny's saber, but the hilt would keep 
moving and the blade would still strike the arm.

I don't see much point in using both hilts on the Ascalon. The ways the 
arms are built, they're more maneuverable when holding it in one hand. 
Overclock it briefly when you're about to hit something, and any issues are 
solved.

Speaking of variation, Variable Phase Shift Armor, it's not needed. It's an 
energy saving measure, which is not needed on a nuclear gundam. Use the old 
fashioned kind, or keep it on full, in case something hits you while it's 
in a low energy state and can't crank up to full fast enough. Did you 
intentionally add this as a weakness? Like, when it uses an overclocked 
weapon, you can't keep PS up?

Is VPSA reactive? If not, it should be replaced with Reactive Phase Shift 
Armor, which spikes it power when being impacted. This would lower power 
draw at all other times, saving the energy for the weapons.

Now that I think about it, the frame needs to be redone as a CE type moving 
frame. Armor is useless with PS, which is useless against beam weapons.

Wait, why do beam weapons have recoil at all? The particles are tiny! Why 
do they barrels need to rotate? They aren't coming in line with any 
mechanism.

Nitpicking aside, it's cool. Can't wait to see the Arch Destiny II.﻿

I like it. I'm not sold on the color scheme (the red on the torso contrasts 
a bit too much with the black for my tastes), but the limb colors are great 
and the line art is solid. The wings have a much more distinct silhouette 
than the canon version, which is a major plus. And the new sleeker forearms 
are much more cohesive with the rest of the armor design. Not to mention 
that the more brutal design of the weapons makes it much more fitting for 
Shinn's personality. It's very nice.

As for the technical specs, I have nothing but praise. The original Destiny 
suffered from trying to be good at everything at once, and it suffered for 
it thematically. Hard to establish a memorable fighting style when you're 
juggling three or four different combat roles. The Arch, on the other hand 
is much clearer. It's all about high-risk high-reward combat. All its 
features have some sort of overcharge or dangerous output level. It 
actually has a cohesive theme to it, now, and I can easily see how it would 
look in action. You guys did a good job.﻿

+7thSenpai
> *"I don't see why its necessary to rotate barrels"*

Because what's the point of waiting for a Single Barrel to cool down and 
charge up again, when you have 3 barrels that when rotated, you can fire 
consecutively with?
When in Normal Firing Mode, the Ragnarok has about the same stopping power 
as the M2000GX does, except it's Revolving Mechanism allows it to fire 
faster. The reason WHY it allows it to fire faster is just as I said above:
You fire with one barrel, that barrel has to cool down for a second and 
charge up. The other 2 barrels are already standing by and ready to fire by 
the time the shot is fired. That way there's no wait time in between shots. 
You can fire it at ALMOST the same speed as you would a Beam Rifle.

> *"Why not use its size as a big ass barrel, imagine utilizing that entire 
length of the gun as one barrel vs 3 smaller ones you have.."*

Interesting design, I like the idea of keeping the destiny frame fairly 
similar to vanilla. Aside from that though, I do have a few thoughts on the 
design:
-The palma fiocina look a bit odd as giant circles in the hands. If the 
palms expanded to change the palma fiocina's output shape between weapon 
mode and energy feeding mode, I think that would make it more believable 
for using the barrel of a beam cannon as a power conduit. Chances are, 
you're only going to use one at a time, so it shouldn't mess with weapon 
gripping too much.
-Awesome anti-ship beam sword, makes much more sense than a large hunk of 
metal that could potentially damage the arm motors with the inertia of its 
swing alone. The weight behind the swing could probably be easily made up 
for with output from the wings of light
-That being said, the wings of light should have thicker articulated 
mounts. The mounts look way too flimsy, even for supporting the inactive 
wings under the influence of gravity. Fire those things up to anywhere 
approaching full power, and I'd expect those things to snap the mounts in a 
heartbeat.
-The ragnarok doesn't look at all like it's built to handle the recoil of 
its normal shots. Considering that all three revolving barrels attach to 
the same place, there doesn't look to be a place to store a recoil 
management system that would push the entire mobile suit back a bit. How
