1.) Well if you have the Wings of Light on, that means you're boosting 
forward. If you're using the thrusters on the tips of the wings, that means 
you're either hovering, ascending, or descending. You can't have both on at 
the same time, it's one or the other. Phase Shift Armor was always able to 
be deactivated at will, btw.

2.) Yeah, that does seem to be a problem as of lately. My definition of a 
Reference is a bit complicated. With shit like saying "Oh, this Gundam has 
a Beam Rifle, so it must be a reference to every other Gundam that has a 
Beam Rifle too!" or "Well, this Gundam has an Abdomen Cannon, so it clearly 
must be a reference to every other mobile suit that has one too!" is 
invalid. With me, I look for Very Specific Similarities, Trademarked 
Features, and just Blatant Unoriginality when I look for references. The 
Victory 2 Gundam was what made the Wings of Light Mechanic famous, so 
that's basically a patented feature of that Gundam since it was the first 
to come up with that unique ability. That's why the Destiny, Strike 
Freedom, Turn Delta Astray, and Delta Astray reference the Victory 2 Gundam 
on that regard, because it was the first Perfected Version of "Wings of 
Light" in Gundam History.
The same thing can be said about the F91's After-Images. That was another 
Special Feature that it was the 1st to patent and no other mobile suit in 
the Universal Century ever had anything like it.
Some people also tried to say "Isn't the Gundam MK-II a reference to the 
RX-78?" And that's not really true either, considering the Gundam MK-II was 
established to be the SUCCESSOR to the RX-78. I mean, Christ, the model 
number is RX-178. It's fucking obvious. Another example is how God Finger 
is also a reference to Shinn Finger because it's the same type of weapon as 
Shining Finger. Even though both attacks have the same premise in mind, the 
one that CLEARLY has closer resemblance is Shining Finger. And ontop of 
that, as I proved in my Destiny Rant, Fukuda even admitted it.
If you have any more examples out there, I would be happy to give you more 
examples.

3.) Yep, I will be making the Strike Freedom rant in the future. As for my 
thoughts on Gundam AGE, I already got started on that w/ Q&A Video #2. 
Check it out if you haven't already. =)

4.) No, the Ascalon's Beam Dagger cannot be overclocked. It's only meant to 
be an emergency melee weapon when used on its own separately.

*Q:* Reasons why you became part of the anime business?
*A:* I love Tomino-san! Only saw the last part of G. My favorite series is 
Turn A. Haven't watched anime in the past 10 years. Instead, watched a lot 
of drama and movies. Star Wars is my favorite movie. Tomino hates Titanic. 
Though I like it (laughs)

*Q:* Difference between reality and anime?
*A:* After all, anime's war is only a fashion. I read newspapers like 
Mainichi and Asahi, but anime isn't really serious. They call it "anti-war 
discussion", but can't comprehend it because it's hard. With my son, I only 
discuss war on the level that it is bad.

*Q:* Difference between First (MSG) and SEED?
*A:* First was during the Vietnam War era while SEED was created during the 
Iraqi War. They say war, war, but it's only a robot anime afterall. Gundam 
elapsed on its own through the times so I wanted to bring it back to a pure 
robot anime, Combattler V-type.

*Q:* Are Mu and Rau Newtypes?
*A:* Both are the last remaining Newtypes. They were the last Newtypes in 
the world so I wanted to write a story where non-Newtype people try to 
solve the problem.

*Q:* Any plans for the next series?
*A:* I can't say it. It's top secret. Movie plan was killed. There are 
plenty of Gundam and Mr. Tomino is still doing it so please guess. 
(translator's note: talking about the Zeta compilation?)

*Q:* Why did Waltfeld live?
*A:* Originally, I didn't plan for him to live, but let him live because 
there weren't a lot of cool adults left. When I saw the VA's acting on 
screen, I said to myself, "Man, he's not going to die." When Morita-san 
heard that, his face had a look saying, "What are you saying when he's 
planning to die."

*Q:* About Yzak?
*A:* He wasn't really a hot-blooded-type character, but his personality 
changed due to Seki-san's (Tomokazu Seki = VA for Yzak) acting.

*Q:* About Dearka?
*A:* Dearka wasn't suppose to switch sides, but I made it happen since the 
sales of Buster Gundam were bad. Sasanuma, Dearka's voice, had a real sweet 
voice so it was hard for him to completely become a bad guy.

*Q:* About the 3 dudes (aka The 3 Druggies)?
*A:* I'm not going to give out their profiles. Just between ourselves, they 
are criminals sentenced to death. They plea bargained as Gundam pilots in 
return for lesser punishment.

*Q:* About Rau, Azrael and Patrick Zara
*A:* They are type of people you can't talk to to solve things so their 
deaths were forthcoming.

*Q:* About Athrun?
*A:* Unlike Kira, Athrun was a disciplined soldier at the start. Which is 
why I eventually had to 'break' him, but that didn't happen until episode 
36 (laughs)

*Q:* About Cagalli?
A: Even though she told Kira that he's a coordinator, she has no 
discrimination feelings. Her father told her to study, but that's not her 
personality which is why she piloted Rouge. Originally, Flay was suppose to 
pilot it, but I made them change it halfway.

*Q:* About Lacus?
*A:* People say they don't really understand Lacus and even the staff 
don't. Only I and Morosawa know her. Her personality never changed from the 
start.

*Q:* About Flay?
*A:* A worried woman who was looking for a place to stay.

*Q:* About Flay's Lalah-esque meaning?
*A:* The title of that scene was "What Flay wanted to tell him." (a way to 
let the audience know what Flay wanted to say). However a dead person can't 
express their feelings so Kira never heard those words. Which means Kira 
never got to know Flay's feelings and he has to carry the burden of her 
death.

*Q:* The finale you had in mind?
*A:* Flay was suppose to be a human bomb. She returned as a human bomb to 
Archangel. She was going to blowup outside of the ship along with Sai. Then 
Kira was going to die with Athrun losing an arm...

*Q:* The meaning of the neutral country Orb?
*A:* That's just an ideal. Japan that is. However, they weren't occupied. 
Think about it, in order to be ruled you need massive military power and 
that's troublesome.

*Q:* Any thoughts on any episodes?
*A:* Hmm, names... I'm not good at naming. Idea of SEED came up while I was 
on the phone. It started with a discussion of naming it with 'S' and I 
thought of Sin Gundam. However, you can't use that in America. God Gundam 
was no good in America so... *makes a joke about God Gundam's name* so I 
named it Freedom. When I thought of this name and announced it to everyone, 
everyone sorta froze and said, "What?!" This is when I believed, "This is 
it." About Justice, you have Ultraman (Justice). Usually you avoid having 
the same names, but "Hey, this is the almighty Gundam! Move out of the 
way!" Kira derived from "killer". Yamato is very Japanese. Amuro was 
"Zerosen" (aka the Japanese WW2 Zero fighter). Kai Shiden was from 
Shidenkai (another Japanese warplane), but Yamato is very easy. BTW, Athrun 
was derived from yo-ake (dawn), Cagalli from kagaribi (bonfire), Lacus from 
mizu-umi (lake).

*Q:* Meaning of SEED?
*A:* At first, there wasn't a meaning. Those came afterwards (laughs)

*Q:* Problem between Natural and Coordinator?
*A:* Since DNA-related subject is a complicated matter in reality too, 
there were a lot of gray area in the anime as well.

*Q:* How come the corpses were very graphic?
*A:* It was necessary. The TV producer stressed, "Show what you have to 
show" so Flay's sex was included. About the death of Flay's father in 
episode 11 and death of Elle-tan (the girl on the shuttle) in episode 13, 
the producer passionately said "it has to be more cruel!"

*Q:* About Flay?
*A:* I thought of 2 ways to keep Kira attached to Flay. One was to give 
Flay a big scar on her face and other was sex. I wonder if I should have 
given her the scar (laughs)

*Q:* About the VA's?
*A:* Auditions, but I already decided who was going to do whom. I fell in 
love with Kuwashima-san (VA for Flay and Natarle) from her works in movie 
dubs. Same with Ishida-san (Athrun's VA). Fell in love with his dub as Luke 
Skywalker. I was definitely going to use Mitsuishi-san and Seki 
Tomokazu-kun.

*Q:* Meaning of each coul? (one coul equals a 13 episode segment of the 
show)
*A:*
1 & 2 - Kira's war intervention
2 - Kira destroying himself due to woman relationships
3 - Recovering Kira
4 - didn't comment

*Q:* Models of each character?
*A:* Kira's model was Tatsuya Fujiwara (played Shuya Nanahara in Battle 
Royale). During that time, Battle Royale was on. Lacus was Audrey Hepburn.

*Q:* Merchandise aspect?
*A:* Anime has to be successful in the merchandise department. Turn A was 
sorry in terms of merchandise. (laughs) The plamodel staff froze after 
looking at the moustache. I was shooting for something in between First and 
Wing.

*Q:* About the difference between the planned story and the final product?
*A:* Aile/Sword related Strike series GUNPLA models sold over 900,000. I 
wanted it to hit the one million mark so Strike Rouge appeared. <-- this 
may have been a joke) The name 'Rouge' was already decided.

*Q:* Any influence/ideas from other Gundam?
*A:* Before I started, I watched CCA and F91. I watched the first ep of X 
and returned the video. (laughs)

*Q:* Who does Kira like?
*A:* He doesn't really like either of them (Flay and Lacus).

*Q:* What is your message of this anime?
*A:* If it's boring, please turn off the channel. Isn't it funny when 
people still watch it even after they call it boring. (laughs)

*Q:* Morosawa is the scriptwriter because she is related? (ie they are 
married)
*A:* No. I fell in love with her abilities. Cyber Formula went well too.

*Q:* Any SEED production stories?
*A:* The plan was set in August. The plan went to Mr. Tomino in December. 
When I was working on SEED, the president told me, "Mr. Tomino won't be 
involved." The president told me to go greet him anyway so I visited him 
during the New Year's holiday. Tomino was enraged, "I made Turn A to unify 
Gundam!" He later said, "Don't trust Bandai" and recommended the book "Cure 
of Turn A".

*Q:* About Gundam?
*A:* Out of all of the previous series, only Tomino-san's Gundam lasted a 
year (Translator's note: Not quite sure what Fukuda means here). Gundam is 
serious. Production cost of other anime is about 10-12 million yen, but 
SEED was 25 million yen (Further note: Presumably, Fukuda means on a 
per-episode basis rather than the entire series cost as a whole). This is a 
business where money comes by adding "Gundam." Gundam is awesome. For 
normal anime, they have to get it within 9 million yen. However, there are 
times you go over the budget which means you cover the excess cost with 
merchandise goods. For Gundam, no one argues if you use 15 million yen 
because it is guranteed that you can recover the cost with merchandise 
goods.

*Q*:( Where did you spend the most in?
*A:* About 10 million yen went to 3D CG. (*many who attended said this 
really didn't answer the question)

*Q:* About Mu stopping Dominion's beam. Is that a miracle?
*A:* It was an anti-beam shield so it can stop it, right?

+MrCreepjo There's actually a short fan-fic about that. It's called "Pillow 
Talk", and in spite of the misleading, it does more with GSD's baseline 
plot then the actual anime, at least in my opinion.

The way the fictional story goes is that Athrun, after Cagali basically 
destabilized ORB's political situation by going all "Gundam 00 Celestial 
Being" and indiscriminately attacking anybody with a gun, ended up finding 
comfort amid the turmoil with Meer, and began perusing a relationship with 
her. 

A conversation between the two leads Athrun to wonder if the current war 
could have been averted had Lacus stuck around and exercised her political 
power as a figurehead for peace, instead of vanishing with Kira and leaving 
the unstable and embittered factions to rebuild on their own with the 
inexperienced Cagali being left to fend for herself while trying to keep 
ORB neutral. The validity of ZAFT being the ones that attempted to kill 
Lacus is brought into doubt as well, since, upon reflection, Athrun 
realizes that the attackers weren't the only ones using high-end ZAFT suits 
- Kira's Freedom Gundam is a suit that falls into the same category, and it 
was stolen comparatively easily, so who's to say Lacus's attackers didn't 
duplicate the feat? It would still entail a traitor, but not necessarily 
Durandall.

Meer, due to having Athrun - or Hell, somebody in general - care about her 
as "Meer Campbell" and not "Lacus Clyne," is not quite so obsessed with 
being Lacus as opposed to upholding the icon of peace she stood for - an 
ideal that, now having gotten over her identity complex and playing the 
figurehead solely for the sake of making people feel better (as opposed to 
trying to replace Lacus and become her), she feels Lacus may have 
unwittingly abandoned to find personal happyness while the world struggled 
to rebuild without her influence. Had Lacus stayed instead of running off, 
Athrun, Cagali and Durandall wouldn't have had to do the things they did 
struggling to pick up the slack.

Meer also denotes that even if Kira is right about Durandall trying to 
murder Lacus, it doesn't give him the right to indiscriminately attack 
everyone (ZAFT, EA, ORB), and that Kira is still responsible for multiple 
deaths, indirect or otherwise - including Heine and several of the 
Minerva's supplementary crew. Two wrongs don't make a right - retaliating 
against Durandal for an assumed wrong isn't the same as justifying becoming 
a rouge faction that attacks without even giving valid reason aside from 
personal feelings as opposed to solid evidence. All the Archangel is doing 
is frightening people with the wild attacks, and making things worse.

Form there, Athrun goes into the fights with a more steeled resolve - 
though, if you want to know more about the full extent of things, you ought 
to read it yourself. Just Google "Gundam seed pillow talk" - it *should* be 
the first thing that pops up. It's only two chapters, but an entertaining 
idea nonetheless.

No, he's not "lacking in knowledge" - you missed his point. He *was* 
talking about how Hyper-Deuteron reactors having limitless energy is *not* 
the same thing as being able to keep up with the power draw. His point was 
that, if you have to keep micromanaging every single thing and switch the 
overclock between functions, then between all that and the energy already 
being used for the flight, weapons and phase-shift armor, the effect would 
be similar to what the Wings of Light do for the original Destiny - it 
would drain the battery faster then reactor can replenish it, and having 
that many systems with such precise and sensitive controls would 
drastically increase the risk of overload or mismanagement of power. Shinn 
could very well be shot down or blow himself up before he ever got used to 
piloting the thing - he needs an interface he is more suited and adapted to 
with which to make the most of.

But that's not entirely the case - with the Freedom, and to be honest the 
majority of his better moments, he'd had carefully planned it all out *before 
the fact*, and in all those instances, his fighting style relied on being 
able to quickly and efficiently replace his equipment - a feature the Arch 
Destiny lacks entirely. Shinn being a good pilot isn't the same thing as 
being able to handle an extremely complex interface system - he's a 
specialist pilot; his forte is in having a small tool-kit and then 
mastering what's in it better then anyone else. If Kira is Golliath ( 
someone that can straight-up overpower everybody regardless of what he 
uses) then Shinn is Sampson (someone that relies on simple, practical and 
reliable tools to match up or beat a stronger enemy). Giving him something 
as complex as the Arch Destiny runs counter to what Shinn's fighting style 
is, and counter to all the traits and skills that enabled him to beat 
Kira's Freedom Gundam. All in all, the Arch Destiny is an alternate - it's 
no more a "legitimate upgrade" from the Impulse then the Destiny is, and 
honestly, the latter is more suited for Shinn.

And for the record, his development was due to that being what the writers 
wanted to do with his character by never giving him his resolution and 
focusing on Athrun and Kira - the kind of machine he flew had absolutely no 
impact. See, you're acting like SEED Destiny was *well-planned* with how 
it's suits were made - but honestly, can you look at the suit designs of 
SEED Destiny and honestly say that ANY of them were made with the intent of 
"evolving the character" or tying into their development as opposed to just 
being (inrended) eye-candy like the Strike Freedom's bling or the 
Akatsuki's gold paint, or (intended) fan-service like the Savior? You can 
blame the Destiny for many things like it's lack of definite schematics, 
but you can't blame it for the writers' own personal choice of having Shinn 
self-destruct - no amount of Destiny re-designs would have changed Shinn's 
character in GSD because he quite simply was never given any senes post-ORB 
that could continue any positive development, and in fact was only ever put 
in situations that seemed tailor-mate to undermine and destroy him.

+MrCreepjo But he also had the habit of using high-risk tactics that 
typically relied on the fast and easy replacement of his more practical 
weapons. Using the prohibitively expensive to build and/or create weapons 
of this "Arch Destiny" design doesn't fit, nor really suit Shinn's fighting 
style. Kira would be a better pilot for this kind of suit, not Shinn - Kira 
and Shinn are genius pilots in different ways: Kira is more about 
programming and micro-management for a broad spectrum of weapons,  while 
Shinn works better having fewer but more specialized tools to work with and 
thus being more capable with those select tools then most other pilots.
